Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2009 01:42AM joanie10 wrote: Hi Guys, Thank you so much for info re, soy, I will take it out of my diet , and speak to my onc when I,m there next, Tom, I also get blurry vision, it is really annoying, but I'm told it will pass, tell Diane to try to only read for short periods of time, and rest her eyes , cool eyepads from the fridge help as well. Pap I,m er/pr + so no soy , thanks, I am really a novice at this, I dont ask enough questions and without the info and help I am gettting on this discussion board , I would be a total greenhorn, we have good facilities here in Ireland, but I'm afraid,  I'm one of these people who doesnt ask , this site is helping me become more pro active, I asked my onc to write down my exact diagnosis, as I was'nt really sure, !!!! didnt know if I was er+ etc, so I hav it all written down now, also action breast cancer .ie sent me a great journey journal, so I can write everything down and keep records of good and bad days etc, s/e,s and so on, keep the chin up everyone,
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2009 01:16PM joanie10 wrote: Tom, I admire your honesty, as a Parent of 2 grown children, I identify with you , and where some people pine when their kids flee the nest, I was pining cause mine would'nt. !!! So please don't beat yourself up over the decision you made, you and Di have bigger fish to fry, so concentrate on recovery, everything else has to take second place., personally I am dreading the Taxol, first one on 10th sept, but glad a/c is over, stay strong, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2009 05:25PM joanie10 wrote: Hi ladies, and Tom!, Starting my Taxol on Thursday, getting it only every 3 weeks, so apparently it takes 5-6 hours,  ugh, also I have to take 10 steroid tabs at midnight on Wed, then another 10 at 6am on thurs morning, also emend on thurs morning, not too happy to have to take all these steroids, but it must be because the dose of Taxol is bigger, as its only every 3 weeks, I will have my last taxol on Nov 18th , which seems ages away, then set up dates for rads, to be honest I,m totally fed up with the whole thing, no hair,, weight gain, fatigue, etc etc , the list goes on and on, on a lighter note, it was great to see my daughter, and we had a fab week of sunshine and catching up,over a few bottles of wine!!, will post after Taxol thursday, heres hoping for few if any se,s best of luck to all you ladies, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2009 01:17PM joanie10 wrote: Cherneski, I was given a 90%to 95% prognosis of it not returning, I am disgusted that your company is treating you like this, I have been out since dx, and I was paid for a few months, but nothing now, and I am officially off the payroll until I return to work, so I manage on my social welfare payment of Euro, 204, which is about 260 us, a kings ransom, I think not, however just another stumbling block to get over, I pray for you as you have been through so much, and when I read your posts it makes me feel like my dx is a walk in the park, I,m currently just over my 6th chemo, with 2 more to go , should be finished mid nov, I am currently training to compete in a 26 mile marathon, so Its a great end focus for me, the run is on 26th oct, so keep ur fingers crossed for me, I,m doing it for a breast cancer charity at home, to try to purchase machinery to enable women to be diagnosed sooner, the very best of luck to you , I will continue to keep yo uin my thoughts and prayers, life's a bitch, but we will see this through, chin up , x Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2009 12:59PM joanie10 wrote: Hi I wonder does anyone know is there an issue surrounding the use of soya products? I am just thru 4th a/c and due to start taxol 10th sept, 4 cycles every 3 weeks, I dont use much soya, mainly milk in tea, etc, but I have been told its not safe to use during chemo?? truth or fiction? any advice appreciated, thanks and hope you are all doing ok,
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2009 12:14PM joanie10 wrote: Hey Sue long weekend here in Ireland too, I have a fundraising day on Sat 24th for bc, and the Marathon on Mon 26th , again for bc appeal, so A busy weekend for me, and you by the sounds of it, good luck with your move, hope its not too stressful, all you other June Ladies, have a great weekend, and keep your chin  up , we are winning this battle, xx Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2009 01:42PM joanie10 wrote: Pam thank you , I had a very good, day, woke up and decided to take control of my life , in so far as I can, so, went for taxol,( btw, asked about the 1hr dose as opposed to my 3hr infusion, no difference, just a bigger dose, ) my friend drove me in,we decided we would go for a walk afterwards if I  was feelin up to it, so I was in hosp for 5.30 hrs, it was fine, went for 8 mile walk, and felt fantastic, the beach was amazing, I really feel very positive,  i,m not going to let s/e's take over, tho the next few days will tell, keep fighting the good fight girls, you are all in my prayers, going to mass tomorrow, so will light a storm of candles for everybody in the june group, hope the church does'nt burn down, lo, XX
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2009 12:51PM joanie10 wrote: Hi All , well as promised , candles burning away with plenty of prayers sent up for all of us here on this site,,had my 1st taxol yesterday,really kicked in the positive attitude, insofar as i,m not going to let any s/e stop me from doing what i want, so after a mixed night of nausea, a bout of dirrohea, and I have a chest infection, I got up this am, switched on the positive button in my brain, went to mass, did 4 miles walking, washed my car, then went to lunch with my best friend, Plan to do an 8 miler tomorrow, and a 4 hour mountain walk on Sunday, dont know when this joint pain s/e will kick in, they told me possibly on day 4 after taxol, as I'm on it only every 3 weeks, I'm getting a triple dose, so I'm thinking the s/e might be more prounounced, but we will wait to see. I'm telling myself they won't be, and I'm going to Portugal on 19th for 10 days to a fab villa my friend owns on the Algarve, so a real girly chillout,3 women with only one agenda, relaxation, Hope you are all doing well and coping with this curve ball called breast cancer, but wise to remember, your attitude at the start of any difficult situation, will have a direct result on its outcome, so keep your chin firmly held high, stay strong, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2009 01:30AM joanie10 wrote: Pam really hope you don't have too many bad s/e's from your 4th a/c. personally for me, this was the worst session for me, I had a lot of nausea and a queasy feeling all the time, coupled with a really bad taste , bit like an oil slick in my mouth which tasted of metal.and of course , tiredness.  I'm on day 7 now after my session, and starting to feel a little better, actually feel like I might be able to do something other than sit and lie around feeling listless. went and did some grocery shopping yesterday with my sister, who is my lifeline, but felt shattered after it and had to rest. perhaps the music festival will be the distraction you need to take your mind off things, sorry I cant be more positive , but would rather tell you how it affected me, good luck , and enjoy your weekend.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 01:07AM joanie10 wrote: Vickie welcome to the club!!! I start my taxol on sept, 10th, it will be given to me only every 3 weeks, for 4 cycles, wonder why its not weekly? had my a/c the same, 4cycles over 12 weeks, so glad I,m finished the a/c, the 4th was one i want to forget. Keep posting on your taxol s/e ,I will post as soon as I get my first one. Susie, glad you are home, there is nothing worse than being in the company of negative people, and there is NOTHING like your own bed, so its worth the trips back and forth, how many fractions are you having of rads? I have to have 25, but that won't be until Dec or Jan. Carolyn, your news is really tough, and I really hope you are coping ok, I will remember you , and all the girls in my prayers, Diane and angicpa, good luck with your taxol,never herard of anyone getting Ritalin, but hey, don't knock it til you try it!!!!!keep the chin up everyone, I,m off to Malta on Tuesday to visit my daughter, cant wait to see her, bye for now, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2009 11:48PM joanie10 wrote: Tom I,m so happy for youand especially for Di, that is the best news ever. well done to Di , just her rads to go and she is cancer free, that is great, then you can both put this whole nightmare behind you and get on with living a long and happy life together. well done, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2009 01:09PM joanie10 wrote: just on the subject of all things cosmetic, my eyelashes are so thinned out its not funny anymore, I have always been complimented on my long thick eyelashes, so falsies on my shopping list, eyebrows gone, but thankfully 2 days before my 1st chemo I got my eyebrows tattooed , really good job, no one knows unless I tell them, likewise with the wig, its a perfect match, but a pain in the ass when its hot, which thankfully is not too often in Ireland !!!, but I have become much more relaxed around people and going bare headed, indoors only tho!! when I want a laugh I watch the sex and the city clip where she rips off her wig and says, F**k it, right in the middle of a chemo flash, you tube it girls, it will cheer you up no end. :>)
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2009 12:54PM joanie10 wrote: Hi Tom, Thank you so much for your advice and I am a lot better with the rash now. I agree with you that the s/e from a.c 4 are much worse, have been nauesous and queasy for 3 days now, terrible taste in my mouth all the time, indigestion and lack of sleep , not a happy bunny, hope it soon passes, i will keep you and your wife in my prayers,
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2009 09:41PM joanie10 wrote: Hi gjlanders, hope you are enjoying you time in Ireland, sorry the weather cant be a bit better for you, I'm lying in bed, it's 4.30 am , and it is lashing very heavy rain, and I,m supposed to be going to the Wicklow  mountains in 4 hours for a hike with some friends, ugh, hopefully it will clear away to a nice autumn day for you before you head back to Germany tomorrow, Best of luck with your rads, my hair is growing back gray , but then its probably cause I,m 52!!! Stay strong, bye for now, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2009 10:07PM joanie10 wrote: DiDit ,  me too, I'm fed up with the fat face , fat body , sumo wrestler look, not really in this season, However all we can do is dress it, put make up on it , and hope for the best, not great timing for your surgery, but just go with it, things sometimes have a way of working out for the best, Polly GO VIKINGS!!!!!!, of course we have a huge history of vikings in Dublin, have to confess I would need to brush up on it, tho there is loads of cultural things to do and see in relation to the invasion of the VIKINGS into Ireland, I will look for a book for you. ok girls, keep the chin firmly up, we are winning, !!!! bfn, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2009 09:01PM joanie10 wrote: Hi All, finding the s/e really bad this time from Taxol. hell of a lot of all over body pain, stabbing, total neuroapthy in my feet, a little less in my hands, actually finding it difficult to walk properly,  I get a taxol every 3 weeks, and I have had 3 , so one more to go , Thank God, sleep does not come easy, even when its chemically induced, ugh, sooner the better this is all just a dim and distant memory, sorry for the rant, but I have been awake most of the night, however shortly I,m off  to the airport for a 4 day spa break in the UK, so perhaps it will take my mind off my pain, stay strong Ladies, bye for now, Joan,
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2009 01:54AM joanie10 wrote: Side effects kicking in big time here after my last taxol, all over bone pain, neuropathy, toenails , only 4 of them left now, not sore though, hair is white half inch spikes, feeling like, and looking like a female sumo wrestler, not having a good day, but glad to be finished chemo. no dates yet for rads, or ct scan, glad of the break from the hospital , to be honest, so I guess the start 2010 will be rung in with rads, scans, onc visits,etc. have a good thanksgiving all my American Ladies, stay strong, we will win,!!!!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2009 01:25PM joanie10 wrote: Hey Polly, My sentiments exactly, I,m through with people telling me how wonderful I am, and how I,m such a positive person, etc etc, and I really want to cover up every mirror in the house so I dont have to look at my bald head and fat face and body, truly not a pretty sight. I,m worn out with the s/e of A/C , first 3 were fine , 4th is terrible. Dreading the Taxol dont know what to expect. piling on the weight, no interest in losing it either, the only thing keeping me going is a trip to see my daughter, she lives in Malta, so a bit of mediterrean sunshine as well, happy days, although she has,nt seen me with no hair, so hope it wont be too much of a shock for her. Tom , you are great to support Diane the way you do, Keep i up , and Polly, you dont need me to tell you , thats right, your an inspiration, lol lol
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 02:09PM joanie10 wrote: Hi Steeny, yes Ireland is a beautiful place, but would love to have good weather to match it,  County Down is approx, 90 min drive away from where I live, it is in Northern Ireland, I live in the south, just outside the capital Dublin, Thanks Michelle for your good wishes, I am dying to see my  daughter, good luck to everyone in the coming week, I will remember you all in my prayers, bye for now, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2009 06:33AM joanie10 wrote: Hi All the Junies, and I am very happy for all of you that are getting through this. I was due to get my 3rd of a cycle of 4 x 3 weekly taxol. But I am delaying it until next Wed.28th, I'm taking part in the Dublin City marathon,( all 26 miles of it!!) in aid of The Mater Hospital breast cancer Appeal. So wish me luck girls to get over the finish line, I will be thinking of all of the June ladies as I make my way around the streets of Dublin. Preparing for this has given me great focus,just hope I have trained enough. and by the way,my hair seems to be growing back, very slowly, but there is a faint shadow of very gray, almost white hair !!!!! but its hair, so , happy days , Bye for now, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2009 08:13PM joanie10 wrote: Hi All, hope you are all doing ok, well for me its been a series of ups and downs, on  day 3 after a triple dose of taxol, the s/e kicked in, a lot of joint pain, neuroapthy in feet and fingers, total fatigue, however I went for  another 8 mile walk, and felt good, then went o the mountains on Sunday with a couple of my walking buddies, I was tired after it but felt good, unfortunatly later that night I had a total relapse of my chest infection, really knocked me down, had to get the doc on Monday, so on a really strong antibiotic and more pain relief, coughing up a lot of crap. but better out than in eh? very weak with it, but hoping to kick its ass in a couple of days, I am due to travel to Portugal with  2 friends on sat for 10 days, so fingers crossed, and my other bit of news is I have decided to take up the challenge to compete in the Dublin city marathon, all 26 miles of it, gonna do it for bc charity, so I need to get better to train for it , its on 26 oct, I,m gonna use it as an end focus to my chemo, as I will have only one more treatment after that, but obviously I will hav to be  guided by what my onc team think, so fingers crossed, I,m coping with the joint pain VIckie, its bearable but annoying, hope ur doing ok, xxx
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2009 09:22PM joanie10 wrote: Diane48 I,m so happy for you ,I too will start rads in Jan. so we can compare notes, think I,m having mapping and simulation done pre xmas, then rads early Jan, good that you are growing hair ,even if, like me, its white spikes, but hair nonetheless!!!!! have to say, I,m not looking forward to the next 10 days of side effects, ugh, all over bone pain, numb feet etc, thank god for pain killers and sleeping tablets!!! however, we are now over the biggest hurdle and we are still strong, so keep doing whatever gets you through each day, blessings to all ,x Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2009 01:49AM joanie10 wrote: Hi Ladies, had 2 rads this week, apparently the machine is serviced once a month on a Friday, so none today, reckon i wil be finished around 18/19 jan allowing for another friday service. However , its great to be getting to the end of it, I met with my Breast surgeon yesterday, and he examined me , went over my charts, and said, "get your rads out of the way, and then you can put this all behind you , " he is very pleased with my recovery, and has sceduled me for a routine mammogram in March, so I,m seeing my onc on tues, and hoping he will say the same, On another note entirely, on british tv this morning there was a study done on bc survivors and alchohol consumption, and there is a definite link to recurrence and wine drinking in survivors,especially post menopausal, now I think most women like a glass or 2 of wine, but i have done a bit of research since hearing that on tv, and it seems its the equivalent of throwing petrol on a fire, so I am making a concious decision not to drink wine , only perhaps a glass of champagne on special occasions, there seems to be enough evidence to support this study,It also said very moderate or occasional drinking is fine,   let me know what you think, by the way , it applies to both red and white, and all alchohol in general , so my new motto is LESS IS BEST FOR THE BREAST !!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2010 04:08PM joanie10 wrote: Hi All and wishing you all the very best for 2010, I finished chemo on 19th Nov, started rads on 9th Dec ,14 of 25 fractions done now, Hair finally starting to grow,,albeit grey and downy, and today I noticed teenie eyelashes and eyebrows starting to come in, I really miss my eyelashes, so I hope they come back as long and thick as before, still a bit of numbness in my feet, but to a much lesser degree , so that too is passing, I can totally identify with the feelings of anxiety and my thoughts are sometimes all over the place, wondering am I through with this, is it going to come back , etc etc, but I try to balance out those negative thoughts with ones where I visualise myself a few years down the road of recovery, and hopefully it will be just a memory of a difficult 2009.But one where we kicked ass !!! We are winning ladies, stay strong, Joan
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 09:27AM joanie10 wrote: I am devestated to hear Michelle is not doing too well, Please everyone pray for her, pray for a miracle, they do happen, I feel helpless and want to do more, but prayer is all I can give at the moment, Michelle, you are never out of my thoughts, keep fighting, like the canny scot you are, !!!! love,hugs,and support to you , Joan

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2009 03:14PM joanie10 wrote: Hi Tabatha , i,m told the infusion lasts 5/6 hrs if you are on 3 weekly cycles, if its every week, then i think about 2/3 hrs, so a bit longer than a/c , i,m getting my first taxol tomorrow, 4 cycles over 12 weeks, so, once every 3 weeks, good luck with your treatments, Joan

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2009 01:11AM joanie10 wrote: Hi , I,m new to this site, and new to bc, just started chemo A/C , dreading the whole hair loss aspect of it, but gotta tell you, I was in the UK recently, and had my eyebrows tattooed, its a semi permanent cosmetic tattoo, lasts 3-5 years, they look fab, so when , and if , my eyebrow hair goes, I still have the tattoo there, she put a great shape and more definition on them, should have had it done years ago!!
